definitions: suggestion or advice about the best thing to do
examples: The doctor's recommendation was to rest for a week
I visited the restaurant based on your recommendation

definitions: person or company that makes or produces something
examples: The furniture maker crafted beautiful wooden chairs
She's a skilled jewelry maker

definitions: idea, feeling, or opinion about something or someone
mark made by pressing something onto a surface
examples: First impressions are important in job interviews
His kindness made a lasting impression on me
The fossil left a clear impression in the rock
Make an impression of the key in clay

definitions: device that produces electricity to provide power
crime of attacking and physically hurting someone
examples: Replace the battery in your smoke detector annually
The car battery died in the cold weather
He was charged with assault and battery
Battery is a serious criminal offense

definitions: spoken or written account of connected events; a story
examples: The book presents a compelling narrative of immigrant life
Each witness provided a different narrative of events

definitions: purpose or reason for doing something; benefit or interest
examples: For the sake of your health, please quit smoking
They stayed together for the children's sake

definitions: act of taking goods or letters to people
process of giving birth to a baby
examples: Package delivery usually arrives before noon
The restaurant offers free delivery service
The doctor assisted with the delivery of twins
She had a smooth delivery at the hospital

definitions: informal short form for representative
examples: The sales rep visited our office yesterday
Contact your local rep for more information

definitions: state of having many different types, forms, or ideas
examples: The company values diversity in its workforce
Biodiversity is essential for healthy ecosystems

definitions: thin cord made of twisted threads
series of things or events coming one after another
examples: Tie the package with string
The guitar string broke during performance
A string of accidents delayed the project
She won a string of victories

definitions: legal action in which someone is accused in a court of law
examples: The company faces a lawsuit over the data breach
They filed a lawsuit against their former employer

definitions: person appointed to act for or represent another person
examples: The deputy mayor attended the ceremony
Sheriff's deputies patrol the county roads

definitions: informal word for a close friend
examples: My buddy from college visited last weekend
Hey buddy, can you help me move?

definitions: profound immorality and wickedness
examples: The story depicts the battle between good and evil
They fought against the evil in their society

definitions: narrow road, especially in the countryside
division of a road marked for single line of traffic
examples: They walked down the quiet country lane
The cottage sits at the end of the lane
Stay in your lane while driving
The highway has four lanes in each direction

definitions: edible seed that grows in pods on certain plants
examples: Add beans to the soup for extra protein
Coffee beans must be ground before brewing

definitions: thick liquid served with food to add moisture and flavor
examples: Pour the tomato sauce over the pasta
This spicy sauce complements the chicken perfectly

definitions: process of examining something to check quality or performance
examples: Product testing ensures safety before market release
Regular testing helps students track their progress

definitions: action intended to deceive or cheat someone
clever or skillful act done for entertainment
examples: Don't fall for that old trick
The email was a trick to steal passwords
The magician performed an amazing card trick
My dog knows several tricks

definitions: pleasant situation imagined but unlikely to happen
examples: Living on a tropical island is her fantasy
The book explores themes of fantasy and reality

definitions: state of being away from a place or person
examples: Her absence from the meeting was noticed
In the absence of evidence, charges were dropped

definitions: mark, sign, or word that represents an idea, object, or relationship
examples: The dove is a symbol of peace
Mathematical symbols simplify complex equations

definitions: action of recognizing or state of being recognized
examples: Facial recognition technology improves security
She received recognition for her volunteer work

definitions: large spoon used for serving food
unit of measurement in cooking equal to three teaspoons
examples: Use a tablespoon to serve the vegetables
Set the table with tablespoons and teaspoons
Add one tablespoon of oil to the pan
The recipe requires two tablespoons of flour

definitions: act of legally taking someone to custody, usually by police
examples: Police made several arrests during the protest
The suspect was under arrest for theft

definitions: feeling or showing that something is good or acceptable
examples: The plan requires board approval before proceeding
Parents gave their approval for the school trip

definitions: serious disease caused by HIV virus that destroys the body's ability to fight infection
examples: AIDS research has led to better treatments
The charity raises funds for AIDS prevention

definitions: state of being free from outside control or support
examples: The country celebrated its independence day
Teenagers often seek independence from their parents

definitions: garden plant with thorns and fragrant flowers
examples: Red roses symbolize love and romance
She planted roses along the garden fence

definitions: spirit of a dead person believed to appear to the living
examples: The old house was rumored to have ghosts
Children dressed as ghosts for Halloween

definitions: act or state of taking part in something
examples: Parent involvement improves student performance
His involvement in the scandal shocked everyone

definitions: thin flexible metal thread or rod
cable carrying electrical current or signals
examples: Secure the fence with strong wire
Birds perched on the telephone wire
Connect the wires according to the diagram
The electrician replaced the old wiring

definitions: small rodent with a long tail
device moved by hand to control a computer cursor
examples: A mouse ran across the kitchen floor
The cat caught a mouse in the barn
Click the mouse to select the file
My wireless mouse needs new batteries

definitions: company that provides regular flights for passengers or cargo
examples: The airline canceled flights due to bad weather
She works for a major international airline

definitions: person who establishes an institution, business, or organization
examples: The company's founder started in his garage
She interviewed the founder of the charity

definitions: thing aimed at or sought; a goal
examples: Our main objective is customer satisfaction
The team achieved all their objectives

definitions: fact or situation that exists and can be observed
examples: Scientists study the phenomenon of climate change
Social media became a global phenomenon

definitions: valuable shiny gray-white metal used for jewelry and coins
color of silver metal
examples: The necklace was made of pure silver
Silver prices fluctuate with market conditions
Her hair turned silver with age
The car comes in silver or black

definitions: unit of money equal to one hundredth of a dollar
examples: The candy costs fifty cents
I don't have a cent to my name

definitions: person aged between thirteen and nineteen years
examples: The program helps teenagers develop job skills
Most teenagers enjoy social media

definitions: person who watches something, especially television
examples: Millions of viewers watched the championship game
The documentary shocked viewers worldwide

definitions: sweet food made from roasted cacao seeds
examples: Dark chocolate contains healthy antioxidants
She gave him chocolates for Valentine's Day

definitions: mother of one's father or mother
examples: My grandmother taught me how to knit
They visit their grandmother every Sunday

definitions: weapon that is sent through the air and explodes when it hits target
examples: The military tested new missile defense systems
Guided missiles can strike targets precisely

definitions: unusual, exciting, and possibly dangerous activity or experience
examples: Their camping trip became quite an adventure
She loves reading adventure stories

definitions: person or company that makes goods in large quantities
examples: The manufacturer recalled defective products
Contact the manufacturer for warranty service

definitions: plants grown in large quantities for food or other use
examples: Farmers harvest their corn crop in autumn
This year's wheat crop exceeded expectations

definitions: state of continuing to live or exist despite difficulties
examples: Basic survival skills include finding water and shelter
The company's survival depends on new investment

definitions: measurable extent of something in length, width, or height
aspect or feature of a situation
examples: Check the dimensions before buying furniture
The box has dimensions of ten by twelve inches
This adds a new dimension to the problem
We must consider all dimensions of the issue

definitions: small round piece of bread for one person
movement of turning over and over
examples: Order a sandwich on a whole wheat roll
Fresh rolls come out of the oven hourly
The ball began to roll down the hill
She did a forward roll in gymnastics
